result.markdown: --- title: "Industry Report" execute: freeze: auto --- ::: {.callout-warning appearance="minimal"} Due by 11:59 PM Thursday February 23 via by Blackboard Assignments ::: # Overview Over the semester, you will write and briefly present a report on an industry that you choose that describes the market for the product: the geographic, vertical, and horizontal boundaries, the nature of competition, costs, demand, and regulatory environment. Please **email me** with the country you would like to choose. I will remove countries from this list in the order that I recieve emails claiming them. You may decide to change your country at any time, at which point, I will re-release the country into the pool for others to select, and update the list below: **Last Update: 9:00 PM Wed Nov 11** You can choose any country *except* for the following that have been claimed: - United States - Vietnam - Switzerland - Chad - Germany - Singapore - United Kingdom - Egypt - South Africa - Greece # Assignment I want you to compile statistics on your country (described below). You will give a presentation on your country during the last week of class. ## Country at a Glance Get data from a reputable source (United Nations, World Bank, International Monetary Fund, OECD, etc.) on the following statistics.^[You might want to look at the [last slide](https://devf19.classes.ryansafner.com/slides/02-slides#114) of our lesson on measuring development for some data sources!] You may write down just the number or descriptor for each of the following on your report.^[You might wish to make a table to organize it.] **For each, please indicate both the source of your data, and the year for the data (try to get the latest possible)**. Note that some countries may not have data available on all statistics (and be sure to not if none is available). Your presentation should include: ### Macroeconomic Data 1. Real Gross Domestic Product (and growth rate) 2. Real GDP/capita (and growth rate) 3. Unemployment rate 4. Labor force participation rate 5. Inflation rate 6. Budget deficit/surplus as percent of GDP 7. Debt as percent of GDP 8. Currency, and exchange rate for 1 U.S. Dollar ### Demographic, Equality, and Health Data 1. Population 2. Population growth rate 3. Human development index 4. Gini coefficient 5. Life expectancy at birth 6. Infant mortality rate 7. % of population living in extreme poverty (under $\approx$ $2 per day) 8. [Happiness index](https://worldhappiness.report/) score ### Trade and Economy Data 1. What are the top 5 exports by value? 2. Who are the top 5 trading partners? 3. Trade (imports + exports) as percent of GDP 4. [Doing Business Index](https://www.doingbusiness.org/) score 5. Amount of Foreign Aid recieved ### Institutions 1. [Polity IV](http://www.systemicpeace.org/polity/polity4.htm) score 2. [Freedom house](https://freedomhouse.org/report/freedom-world/freedom-world-2018) freedom score 3. [Economic freedom](https://www.fraserinstitute.org/economic-freedom/map) score 4. [Corruption Perceptions Index](https://www.transparency.org/research/cpi/overview) score 5. [Rule of law index](https://worldjusticeproject.org/our-work/research-and-data/wjp-rule-law-index-2019) score Be sure to include citations, or a short bibliography of the sources which you used to compile your overview. I do not care about the formatting, just be consistent, and use reputable sources (again, e.g. World Bank, IMF, OECD, UN, CIA World Factbook). # Presentation - [ Example Powerpoint](/profile/usa_example.pptx) - [ Using R to Download World Bank Data (`rmd`)](/profile/usa_country_profile_data.Rmd) - [ Using R to Download World Bank Data (`html`)](/profile/usa_country_profile_data.html) On the last week of class, each student will have 5 minutes to present their country. I expect each of you to have slides to describe your country. # Good Data Sources - [IMF](https://www.imf.org/en/Data) - [World Bank World Development Indicators](https://datacatalog.worldbank.org/dataset/world-development-indicators) - [gapminder.org/tools](http://gapminder.org/tools/) - [CIA World Factbook](https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/the-world-factbook/) - [Quality of Government](https://qog.pol.gu.se/data/datadownloads/qogstandarddata) - [Polity IV](https://www.systemicpeace.org/polity/polity4.htm) - [Fraser Institute: Economic Freedom](https://www.fraserinstitute.org/economic-freedom/map) - [Freedom House: Freedom in the World](https://freedomhouse.org/report/freedom-world/freedom-world-2018)
